title: MED Vol.80, No.101
content:
AI reshaping of industries, legal frameworks, and creative pursuits marches on. Adobe’s strategy to create a copyright complainant AI model by buying videos for $3 per minute, as reported by Bloomberg, highlights the copyright mess. An approach echoed in efforts like the New York State Bar Association’s report, which offers recommendations on integrating AI within legal parameters, indicating a move towards addressing AI’s ethical and societal impacts.

The Generative AI Copyright Disclosure Act of 2024, AI’s + intellectual property, specifically music.

Ethan Mollick’s “Co-Intelligence” explores the collaboration between humans and AI, garnering attention from platforms like The New York Times and Amazon. Platforms like Melodisco address more personal concerns, such as pet issues with queries like “What is wrong with my cat?”

The copper price movement suggests AI’s potential effects on commodity markets, important for electronics manufacturing. The infrastructure and energy factors are just coming to light.

The release of the CosXL demo on Hugging Face, showcases a model capable of generating full-color images

Corporate perspectives, including Andy Jassy’s 2023 letter to Amazon shareholders and Jamie Dimon’s shareholder letter, underline AI’s strategic importance. Dimon points out AI’s role in augmenting and displacing jobs, committing to support employees through these changes.

  • Adobe Is Buying Videos for $3 Per Minute to Build AI Model (bloomberg)
  • Report and Recommendations of the New York State Bar Association Task Force on Artificial Intelligence (ny bar pdf)
  • Generative AI Copy5 right Disclosure Act of 2024  || Press Release  (house.gov)
  • Ethan_mollick ; Co-Intelligence ; Book (NYT, amazon)
  • Guys what is wrong with my cat? on Melodisco  (meldisco) AI banger track
  • Copper price (stock ticker yahoo) AI metal
  • CosXL demo (Hugging Face) Unofficial demo for CosXL, a SDXL model tuned to produce full color range images.
  • CEO Andy Jassy’s 2023 Letter to Shareholders

    Globally, hundreds of millions of people who don’t have adequate broadband access will gain that connectivity in the next few years. Last but certainly not least, Generative AI may be the largest technology transformation since the cloud (which itself, is still in the early stages), and perhaps since the Internet.

  •  Jamie Dimon Sharehold letter

    While we are investing more money in our AI capabilities, many of these projects pay for themselves. Over time, we anticipate that our use of AI has the potential to augment virtually every job, as well as impact our workforce composition. It may reduce certain job categories or roles, but it may create others as well. As we have in the past, we will aggressively retrain and redeploy our talent to make sure we are taking care of our employees if they are affected by this trend.

    …ed note: tried a set up paragraph instead of just links for context and framing; started first with ai and spent the rest of the hour re tooling the lexicon back to mine-   delve into blah blah blah
author: MDG
